We invite you to wander through our virtual center, check out our clubs and upcoming events, and contact us if you have any questions or comments about anything you see (or don't see) here. Welcome!                           General        Center          Resources                                         Education,        Advocacy,          and Trainings                                         Awards and Honorary Acknowledgements                                  Our Mission                                           The New York University Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender and Queer Student Center exists to create campus environments that are inclusive and supportive of student diversity in the areas of sexual orientation and gender identity/expression...                               The Center Accomplishes its Mission by:     Creating a welcoming environment for all people interested in developing their understanding of LGBTQ issues.   Helping students to build communities of care, inclusion, support, and trust.   Recognizing and exploring the ability, age, ethnicity, gender, health, language, national origin, race, religion, and socioeconomic differences in the LGBTQ student population.   Celebrating how differences in the LGBTQ student population can enrich campus and local communities.   Providing direct service to LGBTQ students and their allies in the forms of advising, advocacy, career networking, counseling and referral.   Offers educational and cultural programming, Safe Zone training, event sponsorship and co-sponsorship, leadership development, and weekly discussion groups.   Providing consultation, education and training, and resources to faculty, staff, University offices, and others interested in ensuring that their services are inclusive and supportive of LGBTQ issues.   Providing a comprehensive range of information and resources to all members of the University community about issues that impact the experiences of LGBTQ students and their allies.   Working with other institutions and with community agencies to facilitate student development.   Conducting on-going needs assessment, campus climate assessments, and regular evaluations of the Center and its services.                           Statement of Respect                                           In order to ensure that the NYU LGBTQ Student Center is an affirming, safe, and welcoming location for all individuals, you take on numerous responsibilities once you enter our office and lounge space...                               In order to ensure that the NYU LGBTQ Student Center is an affirming, safe, and welcoming location for all individuals, you take on numerous responsibilities once you enter our center and lounge space.   These responsibilities include:      Maintaining an open mind    Promoting all forms of diversity    Striving to understand in lieu of judging an individual or group based on any condition, characteristic, or circumstance   Using affirming and inclusive language    Sustaining open and honest relationships    Making an effort to positively influence and encourage all people    Paying careful attention to ensure that unrecognized groups, ideas, and/or concerns receive the attention they deserve    Challenging any ideas or concerns which will not contribute to the community in a positive or constructive manner    Recognizing that difference of opinion enriches our learning and should never be an impetus for malicious conflict    Recognizing that all of the aforementioned behaviors are integral to enabling the respectful treatment of others      Any act of oppression, prejudice, intolerance, or disrespect is unacceptable. Should you feel an individual or group’s behavior does not conform to these guidelines, please bring the situation to the attention of an LGBTQ Center staff member as soon as possible.                                       Download our brochure to learn more about our programs and events!                                                                                           Meet Our Staff                                                                                                                                                                             Join OUTPost The NYU LGBTQ weekly e-newsletter! Stay up-to-date on the latest LGBTQ news and events from our center, NYU and New York City. E-newsletters are sent every Friday afternoon. To sign up for OUTPost, send a blank email message to: join-outpost@lists.nyu.edu Read More                                                            NYU Footer          Search      Directory      Campus Map      Events      Contact Us      Site Map      Copyright and Fair Use      Feedback         Unless otherwise noted, all content copyright New York University. Services                       Cyber Center, Lounge, and Library                       Prospective Students                       Faculty and Staff                                                                   NYU Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender and Queer Student Center          The New York University Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender and Queer Student Center creates a welcoming environment for all University students and faculty interested in developing their understanding of LGBTQ issues. Support services, resources, programs, advocacy, training, education and consultation are provided to members of the NYU community. With its services, programs and resources, the NYU LGBTQ Student Center exists to create campus environments that are inclusive and supportive of student diversity in the areas of sexual orientation and gender identity and expression.   The center offers a number of opportunities to help build personal communities and support by connecting students with other members of the NYU community as well as providing information on what New York City has to offer in terms of LGBTQ services. The NYU LGBTQ Student Center is a place where students can meet, discuss, learn and voice the LGBTQ issues they encounter on a daily basis. For faculty and staff, the center is a great resource for ensuring all University services and events are inclusive and supportive of the LGBTQ community. As an institution that fosters and encourages diversity, NYU is committed to supporting the LGBTQ community, and the center is the liaison dedicated to this endeavor and the voice of the NYU LGBTQ network. Navigate this page to learn more about the center and the many services it provides.                                The following clubs meet every other week in the Kimmel Center for University Life, Suite 602 during the academic year. Club meetings offer an opportunity for students to meet other students and to provide a safe space for LGBTQ students and their allies to explore issues and discuss hot topics. Check the calendar for a full schedule of club meetings and events!       Fluidity   For genders and sexualities that fall outside of the gay, lesbian and gender binary. To join the listserve for meeting and event announcements, send a blank email to: join-fluidity@lists.nyu.edu   Men's Group   For gay, bisexual and transgender men and their allies. To join the listserve for meeting and event announcements, send a blank email to: join-lgbt-office-mensgroup@lists.nyu.edu   Queer Grads   For LGBTQA graduate students seeking cross-department solidarity. To join the listserve for meeting and event announcements, send a blank email to: join-queer-grads@lists.nyu.edu   Shades   For lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer students of color and allies. To join the listserve for meeting and event announcements, send a blank email to: join-shades@lists.nyu.edu   T-Party   For transgender and gender non-comforming students and allies. To join the listserve, send a blank email to: join-t-party@lists.nyu.edu   All-Square Student Clubs   Queer Union   This is an All-Square Club advised by the Center for Student Activities, Leadership and Service. NYU's All-University LGBT Club The second oldest college LGBT group in the country, Queer Union is an activist, social, political and educational group. It also runs the Queer Union listserve, a confidential way to get information on campus and city LGBT events and meetings. To join the listserve, send a blank email to: join-queer-union@lists.nyu.edu   CampGrrl   For self-identified lesbian, bisexual, queer and transgender women and their allies. To join the listserve for meeting and event announcements, send a blank email to: join-campgrrl@lists.nyu.edu     Keshet   This is an All-Square Club advised by the Center for Student Activities, Leadership and Service  NYU's LGBT Jewish student group. Everyone is welcome regardless of sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. To join the listserve for meeting and event announcements, send a blank email to: join-keshet@lists.nyu.edu              School-Based Organizations          The following schools have their own LGBTQA-themed organizations. Many of them are catered specifically to graduate students, but please visit their pages for more information:     NYU School of Engineering     Law School   Wagner Graduate School of Public Service   Ehrenkranz School of Social Work   Stern School of Business - Undergraduate Students (Pride Corp)   Stern School of Business - Graduate Students (OUTClass)     School of Medicine   School of Nursing   If you represent a campus organization dedicated to the support of NYU's LGBTQ student community, and wish to have your group listed above, please email the center at LGBTQ.Student.Center@nyu.edu with your group's name and the student demographic which you support and we will happily include you above.
